title: error initialiazing array(?)
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/671

```text
 lfortran x1.f90
input:3:1 semantic error: ArrayInitalizer expressions can only be assigned array references

^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
$ lfortran fmt x1.f90
```
```fortran
program testit
character(len=:), allocatable :: textblock(:)
textblock = [character(len=256) :: "", "aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa", "bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb", "ccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccc", ""]
write(*, "(a)") (trim(textblock(i)), i = 1, size(textblock))
end program testit
```
```bash
$ cat x1.f90
```
```fortran
program testit
character(len=:),allocatable :: textblock(:)
textblock=[character(len=256) :: &
'', &
'aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa', &
'bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb', &
'ccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccc', &
'']
write(*,'(a)')(trim(textblock(i)),i=1,size(textblock))
end program testit
```

I think the issue with "lfortran fmt" producing long lines has been covered, but I think the compilation error may be a separate issue (?).
